content.raw:
There are a number of ways to do this depending on the details of your implementation.

If you are using ROS launch files, one option could be to have the entry point call a python script.  The python script would subscribe to the task message to determine what task is being run.  Based on the task name the python script would call the correct launch file.  A couple of ways to call a launch file from python include using the roslaunch module \([http://wiki.ros.org/roslaunch/API%20Usage](http://wiki.ros.org/roslaunch/API%20Usage)\) or using one of the ways to execute a system call from python \([https://stackoverflow.com/questions/89228/calling-an-external-command-in-python](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/89228/calling-an-external-command-in-python)\).

Again, this is just one suggestion on how to solve the issue, there are may ways you could accomplish this.

‌
